#Text=Via Baltica
#Text=Via Baltica is a road leading through the Baltic States and Poland in Northern Europe .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Via Baltica , officially known as European route E 67 , goes from the Estonia n capital Tallinn to the Polish capital Warsaw .
#Text=It is the most important highway between the Baltic States , and an important link connecting Finland and Russia with Central Europe .
#Text=Some travel brochures exclude the Polish part of the road , and end the road in Kaunas or at the Polish-Lithaunian border .
#Text=The distance from Tallinn to Warsaw is about 970 kilometers , not including any detours .
#Text=The road is mostly two-lane highway and it is possible to drive the whole way in less than 24 hours , but plan for at least three days if you want to see more than just the road .
#Text=The vast majority of travellers drive , but it is possible ( though uncommon ) to go by bus .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Travelers starting from Tallinn usually arrive by ship from Helsinki or Stockholm .
#Text=Warsaw is accessible by road from virtually everywhere in Europe .
#Text=Documents and regulations
#Text=All the countries are Schengen countries , that is there are no regular border inspections and people from most of Europe do not need any visa .
#Text=However , authorities may stop your vehicle in order to check your travel documents and the registration documents of the car .
#Text=More information about entering the individual countries are to be found in their articles .
#Text=Travelers should observe that it is mandatory to have a first-aid kit and a fire extinguisher in the vehicle in the Baltic countries .
#Text=Good maps are invaluable especially in bigger cities .
#Text=Drive
#Text=Estonia
#Text=—
#Text=the capital of Estonia has a world heritage listed old town , well worth visiting .
#Text=—
#Text=Pärnu is the " summer capital " of Estonia , with a fine collection of wooden houses .
#Text=—
#Text=a coastal village known for its beach .
#Text=Latvia
#Text=– for instance near the village of Vitrupe , and both north and south of Saulkrasti there are nice sand beaches not far from the road .
#Text=—
#Text=in reality Via Baltica goes around Riga , but it would be a shame not to stop by .
#Text=Latvia 's capital is after Warsaw the largest city along the road , and offers a wealth of things to see and do .
#Text=It also has a beautiful world heritage listed old town .
#Text=— a major Baltic Sea resort since Soviet times and entails a sidetrip of about 10 km .
#Text=— best known for the WWII concentration camp , nowadays a memorial park
#Text=— a town with a castle at the confluence of two rivers
#Text=Lithuania
#Text=The near Siauliai is not on the Via Baltica , but is worth a detour .
#Text=and , both slightly off the road .
#Text=—
#Text=on several occasions the Lithuanian capital , Kaunas is yet another city with a pretty old town ...
#Text=... as is the Lithuanian capital , about 100 km off Via Baltica but as one of the Baltic capitals also worth a detour .
#Text=Making a detour into requires a Russia n visa for most nationalities .
#Text=Poland
#Text=Less than 10 km east from Suwałki are and .
#Text=— with a famous canal .
#Text=in Belarus is geographically close , but almost everyone will need a visa .
#Text=It is possible to take a shortcut along road 61 from Augustów to and 677 to Ostrów Mazowiecka .
#Text=— the birthplace of Ludwig Zamenhof , Esperanto 's inventor , and featuring an impressive castle .
#Text=, a world heritage site shared with Belarus is a sidetrip of about 50 km southeast from Białystok .
#Text=—
#Text=a side trip away is the site of one of the most infamous Nazi death camps , today there 's a memorial and an exhibition .
#Text=—
#Text=Poland 's capital with an eventful history has something for everyone .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Apart of occasional roadside diners , there is almost always eateries in the towns and cities you 'll pass through .
#Text=Visitors from Western Europe will probably find eating out in the Baltic countries affordable , with a meal and a beverage often well under € 10 .
#Text=If you still want to cut your costs , supermarkets and grocery stores are easy to find .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are hotels and camping sites along the road .
#Text=Also , you 'll find some kind of accommodation in most cities along the road .
#Text=Camping sites
#Text=In Lithuania
#Text=there are relatively few camping sites along Via Baltica .
#Text=Mini Camping in Pajiesmeniai , Sodo str. 3 , Pajiesmeniai ( about 45 km north of Panevėžys , 1.2 km E from E67 , follow camping sign
#Text=) , ☏ +37060329485 , ✉ gerai.labai@gmail.com .
#Text=A friendly family run mini camping site , the owners communicate in English , Dutch , French , German , Russian , Spanish and Lithuanian .
#Text=Places for mobile homes and tents .
#Text=The equipment is rather basic , but includes wifi internet .
#Text=Mobile home + 2 adults + 1 child : 50,5 Lt ( or € 15 ) .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The Baltic countries are part of the euro area , but Poland 's currency is the złoty .
#Text=It is advisable to change some money before the trip .
#Text=In some hotels it is possible to pay with euros .
#Text=The price level is lower than in Western Europe , however imported goods of international brands cost roughly the same as everywhere else .
#Text=Talk

#Text=If you ca n't speak the local languages Estonian , Latvian , Lithuanian or Polish , keep yourself to larger establishments and larger cities where it is comparatively easier to communicate in English than in the countryside .
#Text=In hotels there is generally always someone who speaks English .
#Text=Some basic knowledge of Russian is useful , one should however not assume that everybody understands or wants to speak Russian .
#Text=German becomes more common towards the southern end of the trip , however do n't count on that .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Generally the Baltic countries are safe as long as you use your common sense .
#Text=Car thefts and burglaries are unfortunately more common in this part of Europe , but as long as you do n't leave any valuables on display the risk is small .
#Text=In the night it is also good to choose a hotel with guarded parking or a camping .
#Text=As elsewhere in Eastern Europe and in Poland some people tend to drive fast and take great risks , sometimes there are four cars beside each other on a two lane road .
#Text=The best tip is to keep calm and drive on the right side , however , one has to look out for pedestrians and bikers .
